Note: "spatraster" supported inspire_grid_from_extent(), inspire_grid_from_ids(). clip_to_input logical value. Defaults 0 (buffer). id_format character string specifying grid cell IDs generate. Options "" (default), "long", "short", "none". axis_order character string specifying coordinate order output Short INSPIRE IDs. parameter used id_format "short" "". can one : "NE" (default) produce format {cellsize}N{y}E{x}. Default "llc". parallel Controls parallel execution. Options : 'auto' (default): Automatically detects uses configured mirai future backend one available. set, prefers one available workers issues warning. neither configured, runs sequentially. TRUE: Forces function attempt parallel execution. raise error valid parallel backend (>1 worker) configured. FALSE: Forces function run single-threaded sequential mode. parallelism, must configure backend calling function, example: mirai::daemons(8) future::plan("multisession", workers = 8). Performance tip: Benchmarks show 8 workers provide optimal performance grid sizes. code: # Generate IDs from a dataframe coords <- data.frame(x = c(4334100, 4334200), y = 2684000) gen <- inspire_id_from_coords(coords, llc = TRUE, cellsize_m = 100) ext <- inspire_id_to_coords(gen)[c("x", "y")] # Note: inspire_id_to_coords gives cell centers, so this won't be identical if llc=TRUE  # Generate long format IDs inspire_id_from_coords(coords, llc = TRUE, cellsize_m = 100) #> [1] "CRS3035RES100mN2684000E4334100" "CRS3035RES100mN2684000E4334200"  # Generate short format IDs with default "NE" axis order inspire_id_from_coords(coords, llc = TRUE, cellsize_m = 1000, short = TRUE) #> [1] "1kmN2684E4334" "1kmN2684E4334"  # Generate short format IDs with "EN" axis order inspire_id_from_coords(coords, llc = TRUE, cellsize_m = 1000, short = TRUE, axis_order = "EN") #> [1] "1kmE4334N2684" "1kmE4334N2684"  # Extract coordinates from short ID strings inspire_id_to_coords("100mN34000E44000", crs = 3035) #>    crs cellsize       y       x #> 1 3035      100 3400000 4400000  # Generate IDs from an sf dataframe if (requireNamespace("sf", quietly = TRUE)) {   coords_df <- data.frame(x = c(4334100, 4334200), y = 2684000)   coords_sf <- sf::st_as_sf(coords_df, coords = c("x", "y"), crs = 3035)   inspire_id_from_coords(coords_sf, cellsize_m = 1000) } #> [1] "CRS3035RES1000mN2683500E4333600" "CRS3035RES1000mN2683500E4333700"

title: Convert INSPIRE IDs between long and short formats — inspire_id_format
text: function converts vector INSPIRE-compliant grid IDs long format short format, vice-versa. automatically detects input format fully vectorized handle large inputs efficiently. long format CRS{epsg}RES{cellsize}mN{y}E{x}. short format can either {cellsize}N{y}E{x} {cellsize}E{x}N{y}.

title: Convert INSPIRE IDs between long and short formats — inspire_id_format
Convert INSPIRE IDs between long and short formats — inspire_id_format
text: ids character vector INSPIRE IDs. IDs vector must format (either long short). crs integer representing EPSG code. parameter used converting short format long format. defaults 3035 (ETRS89-LAEA). axis_order character string specifying coordinate order output. parameter used converting long format short format. can one : "NE" (default) produce format {cellsize}N{y}E{x}. "EN" produce format {cellsize}E{x}N{y}.

title: Convert INSPIRE IDs between long and short formats — inspire_id_format

title: Convert INSPIRE IDs between long and short formats — inspire_id_format
code: long_ids <- c("CRS3035RES1000mN2684000E4334000", "CRS3035RES10000mN2700000E4400000") short_ids_ne <- c("1kmN2684E4334", "10kmN270E440") short_ids_en <- c("1kmE4334N2684", "10kmE440N270")  # --- Long to Short ---  # Convert long to short with default "NE" order inspire_id_format(long_ids) #> [1] "1kmN2684E4334" "10kmN270E440"   # Convert long to short with specified "EN" order inspire_id_format(long_ids, axis_order = "EN") #> [1] "1kmE4334N2684" "10kmE440N270"   # --- Short to Long ---  # Convert short ("NE" format) to long with default CRS (3035) inspire_id_format(short_ids_ne) #> [1] "CRS3035RES1000mN2684000E4334000"  "CRS3035RES10000mN2700000E4400000"  # The function also correctly parses the "EN" format inspire_id_format(short_ids_en) #> [1] "CRS3035RES1000mN2684000E4334000"  "CRS3035RES10000mN2700000E4400000"  # Override the CRS when converting short to long inspire_id_format(short_ids_ne, crs = 3857) #> [1] "CRS3857RES1000mN2684000E4334000"  "CRS3857RES10000mN2700000E4400000"

title: gridmaker 0.1.0
text: Initial version basic grid generation functionality. Refined adaptive worker scaling: <50k cells use max 4 workers, <500k cells use max 8 workers, <2M cells use max 16 workers. minimizes parallelization overhead can reduce performance 50% small grids. Benchmarks show 8 workers provide optimal performance grid sizes (50m-500m cells). Default tile_multiplier set 1, benchmarks show tile_mult=2 consistently reduces performance (e.g., 50m cells: 1.97x speedup mult=1 vs 1.47x mult=2). Added user-facing warnings >32 workers configured (performance typically decreases due overhead) tile_multiplier > 1 set.
